org.batfish.specifier

Class FlexibleLocationSpecifierFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.batfish.specifier.FlexibleLocationSpecifierFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LocationSpecifierFactory

    @AutoService(value=LocationSpecifierFactory.class)
public final class FlexibleLocationSpecifierFactory
extends java.lang.Object
implements LocationSpecifierFactory
    A LocationSpecifierFactory that parses a specification from a string. The goals are to be suitable for use on the command line (so a fairly terse format), while also being expressive enough to express any subset of locations. For example, you can simply enumerate a list of locations.

    Recognizes the language defined by this pseudo-grammar: 

     Pattern      ::= [Specifier](;[Specifier])*
 Specifier    ::= ([LocationType]:)?[Clause](,[Clause])*
 Clause       ::= ([PropertyType]=)?[Regex]
 PropertyType ::= node | vrf | interface | nodeRole:[Dimension]
 Dimension    ::= [Identifier]
 LocationType ::= interface | interfaceLink

    A Pattern is a semicolon-separated list of Specifiers. Each specifier represents a set of locations of a single type -- InterfaceLocation or InterfaceLinkLocation. The Pattern represents the union of those sets.

    A Specifier includes an optional constraint on the location type (the default is "interfaceLink"), and between 1 and 3 clauses. Each clause represents a set of a locations, and the specifier represents the intersection of those sets.

    A clause is a regex, optionally prepended with a property type specifier followed by '='. The default property type is "node".

    There property types support specifying locations by node name ("node"), node role ("nodeRole:[Dimension]"), VRF name ("vrf"), or interface name ("interface").

        public LocationSpecifier buildLocationSpecifier(@Nullable

        Description copied from interface: LocationSpecifierFactory
